intro: Galium viridulum var. umbelliflorum, commonly known as the greenbedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often used in herbal medicine for their purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
